net.finmath.time.daycount

Class DayCountConventionFactory

  • java.lang.Object

extends Object
    Factory methods for day count conventions.
    Author:
    Christian Fries

    • Constructor Detail

      • DayCountConventionFactory

        public DayCountConventionFactory()
        Factory methods for day count conventions.

    • Method Detail

      • getDayCountConvention

        public static DayCountConventionInterface getDayCountConvention(String convention)
        Create a day count convention base on a convention string. The follwoing convention strings are supported
        • act/act isda
        • 30/360
        • 30E/360
        • 30U/360
        • act/360
        • act/365
        • act/act yearfrac
        Parameters:
        convention - A convention string.
        Returns:
        A day count convention object.

      • getDaycount

        public static double getDaycount(Date startDate,
                                 Date endDate,
                                 String convention)
        Return the number of days between startDate and endDate given the specific daycount convention.
        Parameters:
        startDate - The start date given as a Date.
        endDate - The end date given as a Date.
        convention - A convention string.
        Returns:
        The number of days within the given period.

      • getDaycountFraction

        public static double getDaycountFraction(Date startDate,
                                         Date endDate,
                                         String convention)
        Return the daycount fraction corresponding to the period from startDate to endDate given the specific daycount convention.
        Parameters:
        startDate - The start date given as a Date.
        endDate - The end date given as a Date.
        convention - A convention string.
        Returns:
        The daycount fraction corresponding to the given period.

      • getCalendarForData

        public static Calendar getCalendarForData(Date date)
        Returns a java.util.Calendar for a given java.util.Date.
        Parameters:
        date - A Date
        Returns:
        The corresponding calendar
